messages.subject: swimming lessons and unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: But that does not negate the idea that swimmies are dangerous.   It most certainly does. In every examply you used, the PARENTS were dangerous, not the
messages.messageBody:
"But that does not negate the idea that
swimmies are dangerous. "

It most certainly does. In every examply you used, the PARENTS were dangerous, not the swimmies.
When my children are too young to swim, I am in the water with them (or another largish swimmer that can hold them), swimmies or not. Most of my children hated any kind of floatable on their body, so I held them. But those that did use some kind of flotation device still had me right there....there's no way any swimmie was dangerous on any level.
I alternate between the kiddie pool and the big pool, holding them and being right next to them. Same thing at the beach. Swimmies aren't dangerous, people are.

Ren
"There is no way to
peace. Peace is the way."
~Quaker saying
